title: In this case, who has the right to jungle?
body:
*Mr X: MID*

*Mr Y: top*

*Mrs Z: adc*

*Mr A: Fill, but not sup*

*Mr N: jg*

*Mr X: Hmm.. Mr A got jg. Mr N is sup.*

*Mr N: Wtf I'm going jg. I called it.*

*Mrs Z: He called it. Mr A didn't call anything. he just said "not sup". Mr N is jungling.*

*Mr A: But I expressed interest first. "Fill, but not sup" - the other three were taken. I called before anyone had claimed jg. Thus, I claimed jungle.*

*Mr Z: You didn't call anything. "not sup" isn't a lane.*

So we had two junglers, and were arguing throughout the match. Inevitably lost. Quite quickly too.

In my opinion Mr A deserves jungle, as his message came first, and by process of elimination, called jg. If he had called "not sup" AFTER Mr N, he would've had to sup, since all his preferred roles were already called.

What do you think?

replies.body: Normally, I would go fill but not ADC but if it ultimately comes down to me having to ADC, then I will. Although, Mr. A did say he did NOT want to support and he technically called Jungle first by most processes and methods so I say Mr. A deserved jungle.
the correct answer here is dodging queue. stupid cannot be reasoned with.
N, he called jungle. A called fill, that means he'll do what's left over. He did say not sup, but that's bs. that's like saying "fill, but not sup, adc jun or mid"

I am not understanding where all these people saying "fill means you get what ever is left" are coming from.

there are 5 places, calling mid is selecting 1 of them, calling mid/jg is calling two of them.
Calling fill is saying all 5 is fine, thus calling all 5.
Fill not ADC is saying top, mid,support or jungle is fine and is calling 4 of them. its just shorter than listing all 4.

fill not support is not "ill take what ever is left" its "ill do any of the 4 rolls that are not support".

and as far as i see it, saying that is far more reasonable than calling jg.

In this case, what should have happened is someone who is not the "not support" guy should have gone support, any of the people who only gave one option, and thus were the most selfish.


I always call "fill no ADC" because I just can't ADC to save my life, forcing me into ADC is like surrendering, but im flexable beyond that, having idiots only listening to the 1st word i say and ignoring everything else as justification to force me to ADC is just moronic.

I totally agree with you, calling a role in reverse 'NOT supp' is less selfish than calling 'ONLY mid' so they shouldn't be punished for it just because they are letting most other people get the roles they want.

100% agree with Lethminite - "Fill not sup" is saying "I'm happy to play any role except support, I'll let you guys choose three of the other four and I'll cover whatever is left.
Obviously there are people out there who don't quite understand this but it's pretty basic logic.
I also understand that this is normal and there is no hard and fast rule about calling lanes; having said that, the Summoner Code can be condensed to the immortal words of Jim Jeffries: "Try not to be a %%%%".
Three people call mid on queue start? Ask someone else to verify who called it and graciously accept whatever the outcome.
Want to call something like "ADC or Feed!"? Run a warm bath and sit in it with slit wrists. We don't want that %%%% here.
Most people come to play for stress relief, relaxation or fun and we don't need immature %%%%s, whiny pricks, toxic bas%%%%s or people who can't be gracious before game, in game and after game.
How did that Summoner Code Summary go again? Try not to be a something something?

How is it bs? He could've called "jg" in that time, and got jungle. But out of courtesy for others (since he was happy to play more than one role) he specified that anyone who desires to play said roles can have them, so long as he gets one. I feel like there's no other way of communicating that, and given his message entered the chat first, his expression of interest in his desired role/roles should have priority.

Also, it's not like saying "fill, but not sup, adc jun or mid" at all - there's no active elimination process involved there, just critical reasoning. And even if he did say that, he's essentially calling top. In which case, he would Top.I feel it's a simple deduction of information.

"i can ADC jungle top and mid. im really bad at support and would like it if i didnt have to"

simple really....

and there isnt any critical reasoning behind either of those "not support" or "not sup, adc jun or mid" its just trash way of saying "im an autistic piece of %%%% and its better to just dodge because im going to cost you the game."

at the end of the day, you are mr A and thus cost your team a game. gw %%%%%%ed %%%%.

Actually, I was Mr X. 

That message would be too long to type when calling desired roles. Also, a person kind enough to write "would like it if i didn't have to" would get manipulated and forced into supping in solo queue. A short, fast, precise message is fine. I think "fill, but not sup" is accurate, short and fast. Thus more appropriate when trying to speedily call lanes.

I lost respect for your opinion when you started talking smack. You're not contributing to the discussion by trying to make points like that.

if you dont really mind where you go as long as its not 1 particular spot....a copy pasted message is the way to go. because its much clearer than "not support" because saying that doesnt give you priority rights over the other 4 roles. the use of fill means you go anywhere, which includes support even if you say not support. because they are 2 contradicting things its a bad statement.

the naming of Mr A when your name starts with A, and your stupid blind choice of Mr A being right, when in fact he is the most wrong of all, shows that you really are Mr A. and thus anything anyone says is not going to change the fact you said fill but didnt fill, you trolled your team by picking a 2nd jungler when someone else already picked/called for it.

but at the end of the day, its normals. if you cant get double jungle to work out, or cant work out a place for everyone, thats your own fault. normals dont matter, there is no reason for you to come %%%%% you wrongness to the boards and expect people to sympathize with you trolling a game and complaining about it.

PS: trash talking trash is the only way to deal with trash. so git gud or kys.

If your logical reasoning is valid, then I would be able to apply it to any situation.

Mr P: Where do you want to eat? First caller gets dibs.
You: Anywhere but McDonalds.
Mr Q: McDonalds.
Mr R: McDonalds.
Mr P: Okay, you said anywhere so let's eat at McDonald's.

No. The way it works in LoL is, whoever calls first gets first priority. Just because you call a "*fill* but..." doesn't give you last priority. "Fill but..." is, in other words, I'll play any of the 4 roles except this one. If you can separate "fill but..." from "anywhere but..." or "anything but..." then your logical reasoning is off.

If, by your reasoning, "fill" definitively means "you'll go anywhere", then wouldn't it mean it would be okay to eat at McDonalds? They're two contradicting things, right? Lol

The problem isn't whether or not you win the game because of the discrepancy; it's about who has the right to what lane because they called it FIRST.
^Best example ever. Upvoted.

^lel

Critical Thinking PHD right there
not really. he said he will go anywhere but support, so if mid or top or jg or adc are left then he would go it, therefore A called it. i guess it could be either, just on the way you see things

But "depending on how you see things" causes conflict. That means every time it happens, a team will likely crumble, or someone will humbly choose a role they don't want. Are you sure both conclusions are as well-deduced as each other?
well its on a personal view on how you see it, could go either way but personal and i think most people would agree that A got it.

*Upvoted*

And when they, as you said, "Humbly Choose a role they don't want" and then play badly, everyone gets on their case. 

Double edged blade.

I think Mr A has jungle because even though he didn't specifically call the position, that doesn't mean that his call is any less valid than if he did, he may have called it differently but that doesn't mean it isnt worth the same.

 and anyway if we want to be purely logical and mathematical about it then by process of elimination there is no argument. 

Mr A: 
"ill have any car but car number 5" 

Salesman: 
"ok sir, cars 1 2 and 3 are already sold so you can have car number 4"

Mr A:
"thanks"

Mr N:
"ill have car number 4"

Salesman:
"sorry sir cars number 1 2 3 and 4 are sold, youll have to have number 5"

I dunno how you can argue against that logic tbh

fill means "i will do what is left over at the end"

so its
mr a "i have any car you have left"
"cars 1 2 3 have been picked, but someone hasnt picked yet, you will have to wait because you asked for fill and fill means what ever is left over, not that you chose all cars and have them on reserve because fill is the UNSELFISH call"
mr a "alright, i said fill, so i shouldnt be a salty douche"
mr n "car 4 looks nice, ima take that one"
"no problem, the %%%%%% said fill, so he is happy to take anything he gets. just because he said not car 5 doesnt mean he reserved every other car to himself."
mr n "well, now he is sitting in my car...wtf am i meant to do? this %%%%%% wont get out of my car and he is ruining the upholstery"
"umm...well...the only thing to do here is call the cops (report to rito)"
mr a "but but but i said i didnt want car 5."
"that means its on your head to go to a different car shop (dodge and get into a new game) and not ruin Mr Ns car. causing damage to everyone elses car when you keep nudging into their cars doing stupid %%%% (fail ganking, ruining junglers jungle path and xp, overall being a %%%%)"

so....there is the ACTUAL logic of the situation.
Mr A caused issues by asking for anything that is LEFT OVER. what if someone calls fill as the first call? do they get all roles? because they called it first. no. they do not. they get what is left at the end. regardless of if they wanted it or not. because that is what fill means. the will FILL in any roles left over once everyone else has selected a role.

But he didn't say just 'fill' he specified 'not supp' did you forget that?
thats no different than calling 'Mid' you are still removing 1 lane from the possible options, you just remove it from your own options instead of everyone else's as calling 'Mid' does, 

but it seems your logic revolves around the definition of the word 'fill'
So if he said "anything but supp" instead of "fill but not supp" would he then deserve to jung in your logic?

"i am willing to do anything" there is the basis of all arguements for fill or anything. just because you specified something you dont want to do, does not mean you get priority over EVERYTHING else.

or i could just go into any game and say "anything" EVERY %%%%ING TIME. and if anyone takes anything i wanted, i am in the right. because %%%% logic. 
good plan, im going to report everyone who picks a role, when i call "anything" because they are taking my pick. hell, im going to report the enemy team, because i called "enemy jungler" and "enemy top", because they are encompassed in the "anything". hell, i can AFK and cant get reported because i called it!

%%%%head....seriously, think before you type.

the first point you make is correct, i don't know why you would even bring it up because its obvious, yes specifying something you don't want to do does NOT give you priority over EVERYTHING else, it only gives you priority over people who call their positions AFTER you in the call order.

for example:

Mr A: Mid

Mr B: jungle

Mr C: Mid

we can agree that Mr A gets Mid yes?
now taking that logic...

Example 2:

Mr A: Mid

Mr B: Top

Mr C: ADC

Mr D: Jungle

Mr E: anything but not support

We can agree that Mr E has to go support (even though he didn't want to) because he is last in the call order agreed?
so now...

Example 3:

Mr A: Mid

Mr B: Top

Mr C: ADC

Mr E: Anything but not support

Mr D: Jungle

Because Mr D is last in the call order, his call has less priority than Mr E who called first and even though Mr E didn't call jungle specifically, by order of elimination he gets to go jungle because he specified 'Not Supp' this means that calling a role in reverse (Eg. 'Not support') has no more or less priority than any other call, it is just called in a different way, and as long as the person calling 
'not that role' is high enough in the call order for any position other than the one specified to be available then he gets that position.
however, if he is the last in the call order then he has to go whatever position is left regardless of what he specified, just like anyone else would. How does that not make sense?

in regards to your second point about calling "anything" and then reporting anyone you want:

firstly: 
you may have your meanings mixed up because by calling "anything" you are actually saying "ill take any role, therefore because i don't mind which role i go, i will let you guys choose your roles first and take whatever is left"
its just the same as not calling anything and just accepting whatever role is left
so why you think it would give you the right to take any role you like just confuses me because thats not what it means.

Secondly:
You said it in a joking fashion but reading between the lines it sounds like you think you can report someone for taking your position,
I hope you don't report people for taking your position, because that would be a grave miss-use of the report button. Even if you called Mid first and someone else instalocks, sure thats annoying, but it isn't a report-worthy offence, they haven't broken any rules or been obusive to anyone, remember here that the 'I called X position first' system is player made and is not part of the game itself, and while it is polite to follow that system, it is by no means obligatory. 

Thirdly:
How is this long and swear-word ridden story at all relevant to the question?

so...you counter your own logic.

anything but XXX gives priority over everything but XXX.
but then anything gives "whatever is left over"

say with your %%%%ty example:
player 1: "anything but support"
player 2: mid
player 3: top
player 4: jungle
player 5: adc

where does player 1 go? everything is called AFTER his call, but his call said he will fill/do anything. but support.
so he gets priority of all 4 other roles because nothing was called before him.

no, that is just wrong. if you say you will do anything, that supersedes EVERYTHING else.

and finally, just because it has some % in it, doesnt mean its any less correct or relevant. infact its infinitely more relevant than your piece of %%%% drivel.

Please show me where i countered my own logic and what logic i countered as everything i have said should follow the same logic copy and paste the bits i have contradicted and the part that contradicts it and explain why please.

you aren't understanding what i am saying, so please read the following carefully:
calling 'Anything but support' only means that you will not be playing support it does NOT mean you can choose any other position, it means you will get the last available position that ISNT support, (unless you are last pick of course and have to just accept whatever is left)

therefore in you're example:
Player 1 called first, so his pick has HIGHEST PRIORITY (in the case of multiple people calling a position) as usual,
and Player 5 called last which means that he gets the pick that no one else wants, as usual.

Player 1 said "i will play anything except support"
Player 2 said "i won't play anything except Mid"
Player 3 said "i won't play anything except Top"
Player 4 said "i won't play anything except Jungle"
Player 5 said "i won't play anything except ADC"

So taking the logic that 'first to call gets priority.'

Player 1 Gets the right to NOT play support (He does not get the right to choose the position he does get)
Player 2 Gets the right to play Mid 
Player 3 Gets the right to play Top
Player 4 Gets the right to play jungle
Player 5 Has to take whatever is left (in this case, support, as player 1 already won the right to not play support and so by default player 1 gets ADC)

So to answer your question Player 1 gets to play the position with least call priority that isn't Support so in this case he gets to play ADC.

you seem to think, that i think, that calling 'Anywhere but support' means you can go anywhere you want as long as it isn't support. 
that is NOT what i am saying. Calling 'Anywhere but support' means that you get the the pick no one else wants as long as it isn't support. 
Apart from not getting support, you don't have a choice on any other position.

also i have noticed in your arguments that you seem to be mixing up the meaning of the words 'Anything' and 'Everything'

Calling 'Anything' means:
"Ill have the left over position"

Calling 'Everything' means 
"I will play any position i want"

they are different things and the argument is about calling 'Anything but' NOT 'Everything but'

with regards to your last point:
I never said the use of swearwords diminishes your argument, i used the words/phrase 'Long' and 'Swear-word ridden' 
as adjectives to describe the story, and THEN called the story 'not relevant' 
that does NOT mean 'the story isn't relevant BECAUSE of swearwords' it means 'the story WITH swearwords, isn't relevant'

However now that you bring it up, even though using swearwords doesn't diminish your actual point, it does take away from the credibility of your argument. A debate should always be objective 
(which means taking yourself out of it, leaving just the facts)
Using swearwords shows a level of personal attachment to the argument, and having personal attachment means that you MIGHT possibly twist the facts to suit your own gain, (and is therefore frowned upon)
if ever you are unlucky enough to be in a court of law you will notice that NONE of the lawyers have any personal attachment to the argument, you will not see them crying or swearing or laughing, (if they are good lawyers anyway)
as soon as you bring emotion into an argument you lose credibility, thats just a fact (i don't make the rules)

and i know this is an internet forum, but it still holds the same logic as a court of law even if it doesn't have the same importance as one. 
(but by all means continue to use swearwords it only makes my argument more credible and yours less so)

btw: 
Credibility isn't the same as being right or wrong.

but anyway whoever is right and who isn't, we both look like fools for getting so deep into a pointless internet dispute on a forum that doesn't even matter. But that shouldn't matter though, its kinda fun, i like debates.
10/10. Couldn't agree more.
Your replies are moronically entertaining to read. They're also heated and offensive. Lel.

> Even if you called Mid first and someone else instalocks, sure thats annoying, but it isn't a report-worthy offence, they haven't broken any rules or been obusive to anyone, remember here that the 'I called X position first' system is player made and is not part of the game itself

It's definiteley a community-made system, so reporting based on solely that fact is meaningless. But if I recall correctly, there's a "report for refusing to communicate with team" option. And since the rule is widespread, and occurs in every game, it is in each team's interest to honour the system. Disregarding it, and thus not communicating with the team would, in my opinion, be reportable (though, not the most severe offense by any means). We'd have to check with Rito if they consider that a form of team-communication negligence, but I'd assume so. But... We'd never get an actual reply from them about it though. Something to think about I guess.
There is nothing in the Summoners Code that mention call order being Law. Its up to the players to work out who goes where.

True, but given the short amount of time allocated to organising lanes in solo queue (and with the possibility of early/instalocks), anarchy ensues. So the community naturally created a system of self-government. That system is the "first call gets priority". We are now investigating the specifics, as would be done when setting up a legal system to govern a newly formed society.
i could say "not support jungle" and then go assassin jungle. by your fail logic atleast.
You clearly don't understand the topic very well.

Mr N has the right, Mr A called fill which means he's fill, regardless of whether he specified 'not supp' (fill is fill no matter how you look at it). If Mr A had called something like 'prefer jungle/not sup' then he would have the right to be jungle.

How then, would he explain his contentedness to play any role except sup? "Fill" means "any role". "Fill but not sup" means "any role besides sup". That's not trying to look at it differently, that's expressing yourself more precisely. And In my opinion, there's nothing wrong with that.

Sorry for the really late reply but had some trouble with logging in the last few days (thanks Rito).

On topic: Fill does **not** mean 'any role' it means 'last available position', adding on 'but not supp' doesn't change what fill is. Mr A called fill and thus was left with the last remaining position (support in this case) but if he had called jungle after realising that it was the only position left that he didn't want then he might have the right to jungle. The fact remains Mr A called fill and the last available position was support. You ask how he could have expressed his contentedness to play positions other than support but there are two examples of that in my original post (check the last sentence).

Same. Fckn Rito. 

> Fill does not mean 'any role' it means 'last available position'

"Fill": Last available position. 

"Fill not sup": Last available position besides sup. Pretty sraight forward.

*"As soon as you say fill, successive words become meaningless. English breaks down after that point, and describing preferences any further is a contradiction, because fill is a word of absolute definition and priority."* - HeartVine 2015

Stating 'not supp' after using the term 'fill' is contradictory, fill is the last available position but adding 'not supp' contradicts that if supp is the last available position. There are lots of ways to say that you want any position other than supp but 'fill but not supp' is not one since it's a contradictory statement.

> Fill does not mean 'any role' it means 'last available position'

"Last available position, besides sup" - no, that's not a contradiction, it's a specification. It means "I am expressing interest in the last available position of the other four roles". If top, mid and JG are called on or after the time of his call, ADC is the result. If all roles are called by the time of his call, he goes sup, as he did not call quickly enough to get his desired role. 

The poll is in favour of Mr. A. (no surprises there). Since there's no specific rules set by Rito, and the generally accepted rules are made by the community, the community determines how roles should be called and allocated. Since, assuming accurate data in a sample size ~30, the community rules in favour of Mr. A.

On another less scientific, less politically correct note, notice the quality of the majority of the arguments from those who are in favour of Mr N. compared to those who are in favour or Mr. A. There's a clear difference in articulation, reasoning and progressive logic between the two, skewing more towards Mr. A-favoured arguments. It might say something about the superior aptitude of the majority of people voting for Mr. A.

I too had issues with getting into the forum - but thankfully Rito has now fixed it.

There is validity to the argument that "fill" is equivalent to "I'll take whatever role is left".
Heartvine, if Mr A had called something like "Anything but support" as opposed to "fill not supp" would you be more inclined to side with them?  

Is the issue you have more centred on terminology rather that logic?

You're also correct that The Summoner Code has no rules about this; to have a rule about every aspect of the game would condemn everything to the toilet.  The Code deals more with the spirit of how people play, rather than setting down a heap of rules.

In this case, Mr A who essentially indicates "I'm happy to play any role except support" (terminology here, take note) is acting more in adherence to the Code than Mr N who has a conniption and announces "wtf I called jg I'm going jg anyway". 

Anyway, I voted Mr A. Logic should prevail in a community of nerds anyway ;o)
Funnily enough, he didn't actually say fill. He said "not sup". I used "fill" in the example to provide clarity and understanding - since it's a widely used term.

And it took you this long to mention that? You neglected to make mention in the original post that was the case, and even after a few people, myself included, argued that they didn't have the right **because** they used the term 'fill' you still neglected to mention it? And I'm supposed to believe that? Not buying it.

Also, personally, I don't find "not [x position]" an appropriate way of calling, however if the other 3 people have no issue with it I'll let it slide (which is not how the scenario in your OP went down).

You do know that calling "not X position" is no different than calling "X position" someone is still left with the last position that no one wants, and the "not X position" actually gives more people a chance to get what they do want... why do you have a problem with that?

Didn't neglect it. In fact, because I believe "fill" and "any role" are the same thing, and it is obviously implied (in the context of the situation) that "not sup" means "any role but sup", I purposely avoided mentioning it, to try and understand why people picked on the word "fill" so heavily as though it was completely different, despite it meaning the exact same thing. And from what I've seen, the information simultaneously consider is simply too much for some people to synthesise accurately.

I'm telling you it's the truth, couldn't care less if you "buy it" or not. I take pride in honesty.

You're saying "fill, not sup" is different from "not sup" and "any role besides sup" even though, in 100% of practical cases, the caller will be trying to convey the exact same message? As far as I'm concerned they're perfectly synonymous when calling roles.

> Also, personally, I don't find "not [x position]" an appropriate way of calling, however if the other 3 people have no issue with it I'll let it slide (which is not how the scenario in your OP went down).

If it's an understandable communication of interest in specific roles that couldn't reasonably be inferred  innacurately, I don't see why It shouldn't be considered a legitimate/appropriate/unquestionable method of calling. If you can see another way "not sup" could be interpreted (in a practical context), please give me an example. 

"Calling" in itself is just a heirachally prioritized expression of interest in particular team roles. Calling "not sup" in the context of a solo queue champion-select screen falls under that category. It may not be as simple as "mid" or "sup" because there are terms and conditions associated, but it's just as transmissible (assuming basic understanding of conditional logic), and in fact, less burdening on teammates choices.

Think of it like maths,

5 - 1 = 4

Fill (all 5 positions) - Support (1 position) = 4 available positions

instead of

1 + 1 + 1 + 1 = 4

Mid (1 position) + Top (1 position) + Jungle (1 position) + ADC (1 position) = 4 available positions

now looking at those two equations, which is most efficient for getting your meaning across?
the long one or the short one? the one where you have to type out 4 position or the one where you type 2?

the fact that he used the word fill is irrelevant, the definition of 'Fill' is not 
"Unconditional acceptance of the last available position in the online game League of Legends"

'Fill' is a word used by the player base to best get their meaning across. NOWHERE is it defined as unconditional 
not in the dictionary not in the summoners code not even in the terms and conditions of the game.

anyway due to human error you cant be that hung up about wording,
if someone called: Mdi or Mif or Tpo or ADC] 
would you deny them the position just because technically there is no 'ADC]' position?

How is 'Fill not supp' different than 'Mid not supp'
both express where they want to go
one wants the last available position that isn't support
and one wants mid as long as it isn't support.

the second guy (who wants mid) gets his wish why shouldn't the first guy?

also you mention the login troubles, did you get the 'Internal server error' or something like that
cos i cant login on my laptop because of that, how did you get around it?

> [{quoted}](name=Lord Sesshomaru,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=9U1AjIh4,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-03T01:27:15.170+0000)
> 
> also you mention the login troubles, did you get the 'Internal server error' or something like that
> cos i cant login on my laptop because of that, how did you get around it?

Yeh, that's what I had but have no idea what stopped it, haven't changed anything since before it started appearing. I was in contact with support at the time to try and sort it out but didn't get around to doing anything before it fixed itself.

Also guys opinions on those people who come in and this happens

A:Me and C bot lane
B:ADC/Support
C:No I'm ADC/Support

%%%% this pisses me off when duos think this is logical.
Isn't it logical to let duo's have the duo lane? for best communication and thus better results...
